entry.title: install Adobe document system service for an S4H 1809 On premise
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We have the need to install ADS (Adobe document system) service for an S4H 1809 On premise.

According to the following information we require an AS JAVA Netweaver 7.5 to install this product.

 In order to achieve this we have the following questions:

 ¿Can we install the ADS components in the existing JAVA system where we have agent administration (AgentAdmin) and SLD to solution manager?¿Is it suitable or mandatory to run on a new Java system so as not to impact negatively SOLMAN functionality or what are the considerations to take into account?. Also we need to know if the same ADS service can be used to different systems or is it better to install one that works with developement system, other to quality and other one to production?.

BR

entry.title: Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog
entry.content:
Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog!!!

As soon as such a Business Catalog change is published, as per SAP, "all roles need to be processed to ensure consistency since the data does not have a link anymore between the removed IAM apps and the affected catalogs."

Yes, it processes all roles in the system

In our case, it was 6000 roles in the system. As you can see, the publishing/unpublishing jobs have been running for 7 days now and still continuing. We have been in touch with SAP Support. Their explanation of how publishing works: "In general, it works like this: if a publishing process A is triggered, it is processed right away. If during this process new publishing processes B and C are triggered, this is added to a queue until the publishing process A from before is done. Then B and C will be processed together. Now, if there are 10 or 20 of them queued up, they all will be processed together and depending on the objects, this can take longer. "

There were 30-40 processes running in the system at the beginning. Now after 7 days, it has reduced to 11 processes. It locked up all the business roles for changes during the publishing process - Security team can't make any updates to roles for several days. Developers couldn't create new apps/communication scenarios/services etc. in the system. 

So, what is the workaround for this if someone really wants to remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog? The only way I could think of, is to create a brand-new Business Catalog and move whatever apps that are really needed into the new one. But, what if few months down the line, someone wants to remove another app from that 2nd Business Catalog? ... and so on...

Does this mean, to avoid all this trouble, developers should be allowed to have only one IAM app per Business Catalog? Are there any other possible ideas?

entry.title: BOP is not working for MTO scenerio
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a requirement for MTO scenario(Strategy group B6) where the BOP is not confirming the sales order even after the planned order is firmed. 

Expectation is that we need automated process (Batch job) where once the planned order is confirmed, sales order should get confirmed based on BOP run.

Please note when we do manual availability check in sales order, it works.

In the BOP settings, we are using the strategy "Improve" as the business need is that we want the order confirmation based on First Come First Serve basis.

Can you share your input on this?

With Regards

Vinu Nanjan

entry.title: Re: Launch of Role Based Certifications for SAP Business Suite for Partner Sales, Presales and CEE R
entry.content:
@SapnaS - Thank you for the information, but there's significant confusion that needs clarification:

Pricing Discrepancy Issue: You mention Learning Hub subscription is required for certifications, but there are conflicting prices:

  • Your response suggests ~€390 (as mentioned by @KentP)
  • Official SAP pricing shows $1,428 USD per user per year: https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/learning-hub.html

That's a 300%+ price difference! Which pricing is correct for partners?

Business Logic Question: If the Learning Journeys are free and our teams are already qualified professionals, why do we need a $1,400+ annual Learning Hub subscription just to take a 30-question, 1-hour exam?

Suggested Alternative: Wouldn't it make more business sense to:

  • Keep learning content free (as stated)
  • Charge a reasonable exam fee (<$100) for qualified candidates
  • Remove the Learning Hub barrier for partners who just need certification validation

Current Situation: This pricing structure is forcing qualified partner resources to pay over $1,400 annually just to validate existing expertise. This seems counterproductive to SAP's partner enablement goals.

Request: Can you please clarify:

  1. What is the actual Learning Hub cost for partners?
  2. Why is an expensive annual subscription required for a simple certification exam?
  3. Are there plans for a more cost-effective certification-only option?

Many partners are facing this same confusion. A clear, public response would help the entire community.

Thanks for your assistance in resolving this matter.

entry.title: Re: A top level package already exists for the software c...
entry.content:
Hi juan_gonzalez

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (developer extensibility), each software component such as ZCUSTOM_DEVELOPMENT can have only one top-level package.

The following reason is why you get the error

  • The message A top level package already exists for the software component ZCUSTOM_DEVELOPMENT means that the root package for this component has already been created.
  • The system does not allow you to create another top-level package under the same software component.

Here is the standard approach

  • Instead of you creating another top-level package, you must create a sub-package under the existing top-level package.
  • For ZCUSTOM_DEVELOPMENT, the top-level package typically already exists in your system.

Here are my suggested steps to proceed with

  1. In Eclipse --> open ABAP Repository Tree.
  2. Locate the existing top-level package for ZCUSTOM_DEVELOPMENT.
  3. Right-click --> New  --> ABAP Package.
  4. Enter your desired sub-package name.
  5. Assign it to the transport layer YDEV.
  6. Save and continue development under this sub-package.

Here are some references to further guide you:

Developer Extensibility in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Creating and Using ABAP Packages in Cloud

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Upcoming Deprecation of VBScript, its Impact on SAP GUI Scripting and Resulting Strategy
entry.content:
Hi Stefan,

I just stumbled about this post regarding the deprecation of VBScript; upon reading that this will indeed take a long time I was in a bit of panic, mainly because I use SAP Connections with VBS for various things, for example getting information from specific systems and transactions with VBS (with the SAPGUI Recorder) and then using VBA and Excel to format them and process them further.

Now I have read about it and tried various methods to use Powershell, but everytime I try it, it does not work. I can open the SAPGUI with the System, Client and Language but when I try to connect to the Session to manipulate it, I get errors, it seems to have something to do with not being able to use a COM Object or get the Active X Object (in VBS I would use GetObject(“SAPGUI”), but I could not get it to work in Powershell: I tried using the MSScriptControl Method, the Microsoft.Visualbasic.Interaction Method and the [runtime.interopservices.marshal]::GetActiveObject Method, but nothing works, I always get either error messages (Can’t create object or Class not registered) or it just fails and does not give me a Com Object to process. The fact that I’m jumping from VBS to Excel & VBA then is just the cherry on the top. I’m using Powershell 5.1 with the ISE in a 64bit environment (with SAPGUI 8.00 64bit); both PS and the GUI are running in User Context.

I read about your Tracker and a COM.ps1 and also tried some of your scripts, but I also cannot get them to work.

If you have any advice, it would be greatly appreciated.

Regards, Torsten Hambsch.

entry.title: Re: Customize PO Print template
entry.content:
Hi Dylan2

Thank you for your question. let me address your two points:

  1. Form Template vs. Master Form Template
  • Please note that in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Master Form Template (e.g. YY1_SOMU_FORM_MASTER_A4) provides the overall layout such as header, footer, logo and sender address.
  • The Content Form Template for example PO form provides the business-specific data and structure.
  • If the field Form Template is empty in your rule, the system will take the default content form template assigned for that business object, in this case, the Purchase Order template. It will automatically link it to the defined Master Form Template.
  • So yes, if it is empty, the system will still pick the content template but use your selected master as layout.

Form Template Determination – SAP Help

  1. Usage of the “Number” field
  • The Number in your configuration (501 in your screenshot) defines the priority or sequence in which rules are evaluated.
  • Lower numbers equals higher priority.
  • If you applied multiple rules and they match, the system takes the one with the lowest number first.
  • So yes, if you create a new entry with a smaller number (e.g. 100 instead of 501), the system will apply your new rule instead of the default one.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unable to use reference field in bank statement memo...
entry.content:
Hi Stanco, 

Thank you for clarifying, maybe some more details might help you.

You are right that in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Reference field (Assignment) that flows from sales order à invoice à open item is limited to 16 characters. Unfortunately, this limitation is part of the standard data model in Financial Accounting and cannot be extended with Key User Extensibility in the Reprocess Bank Statement Items app.

Below you will find what standard alternatives are available

  1. Payment Reference Field (Document Reference ID)
    • In S/4HANA Cloud, the payment reference field in the invoice (field Document Reference ID) can carry up to 30 characters.
    • This field is designed for payment reconciliation and can be mapped from the CAMT.053 file.
    • If you populate this field in the invoice instead of the sales order reference, the reference will also be available in the bank statement for matching.
  2. End-to-End ID from CAMT.053
    • If your bank sends a longer unique reference which is up to 35 characters in the CAMT.053 EndToEndId element, S/4HANA Cloud will map it into the open item as Payment Reference.
    • This can then be used in the Reprocess Bank Statement Items app.
  3. Processing Rules or Interpretation Algorithms
    • Please not that in the Manage Bank Statement Reprocessing Rules app, you can set up rules to match open items not only on the 16-character reference field, but also on Payment Reference or Document Reference ID if these are populated.

Please note that the following is not possible

  • The 16-character technical limit of the reference or assignment field cannot be extended in Public Cloud.
  • The Reprocess Bank Statement Items app does not currently support extension of this specific field through Custom Fields & Logic.

The following documentation provides more detail:

  • Manage Bank Statement Reprocessing Rules – SAP Help
  • Payment Reference in Bank Statement Processing (CAMT.053)

To help you solve the issue I recommend

  • Move your long external reference (≥20 chars) from the sales order reference into the Payment Reference or Document Reference ID field of the invoice.
  • Ensure your bank provides this in EndToEndId in CAMT.053.
  • Use Reprocessing Rules to match based on this longer field instead of the 16-char reference.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Parameter for External API CDS View on SAP Hana Cloud...
entry.content:
Hi DiegoDuarte

Thank you for your question and I hope this can still be of help to you.

You are right, when creating an External API CDS View in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, it is not possible to define your own manual parameters.

Below are a few reasons why you see the error

  • External API CDS Views are meant to expose released data via OData for external consumption.
  • By design, they do not allow user-defined parameters.
  • Parameters can only be inherited from the underlying Data Extraction CDS Views.

There is an important limitation you should note

  • Even if your Data Extraction or Standard CDS View contains a parameter, this parameter cannot be propagated into the External API CDS View.
  • This is why you end up with the error “Manually created parameters are not allowed for External API”.

Here is how you can filter data instead

In Public Cloud, SAP recommends filters instead of parameters for External API CDS Views:

  1. Expose the field as a filterable property in your CDS view for example SalesOrg, CompanyCode, GLAccount, etc.
  2. When calling the API externally, use $filter in the OData request.
  3. This ensures that consumers can restrict the data without parameters.

References

Exposing a Custom CDS View as External API

Custom CDS Views – Restrictions in Public Cloud

To summarise, parameters are not supported in External API CDS Views and manual creation is blocked. Filtering must be done using OData $filter on exposed fields. If you require fixed restrictions, implement them inside the underlying CDS View, but do not expect parameter propagation.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Stated Amount Including Input Tax - Manage service en...
entry.content:
Hi @baher155555  @diogolf_moreira 

Thank you for your question.

You are using the Manage Service Entry Sheet Lean Services app.
The screenshot and description are correct: even though you assign a tax code, the “Stated Amount Including Input Tax” does not add the tax.

Below is the explanation of behaviour you are experiencing

  • In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Service Entry Sheet is only a logistical confirmation of services received.
  • The Service Entry Sheet shows:
    • Stated Amount: this is the net value of services.
    • Stated Amount Including Input Tax: this field displays the same value because taxes are not calculated at Service Entry Sheet level.
  • Tax calculation happens at invoice posting, not in the service entry sheet.
    • When the supplier invoice is posted via Create Supplier Invoice or Ariba integration, the tax code is applied and the system posts tax to the relevant G/L accounts.
  • Therefore, the Service Entry Sheet level never adds tax on top of the stated amount.

Below are what you cannot do

  • It is not possible to configure Service Entry Sheet to calculate or display gross amount. This is standard system behaviour in Public Cloud.

These are the possible alternatives:

    • Use the supplier invoice apps for example Create Supplier Invoice or Manage Supplier Invoices to display net and gross amounts with tax.
    • If you need the Service Entry Sheet to show “gross” for reference, you will need to build a custom analytical report (e.g. CDS view + custom field showing calculated gross = net + tax), but the standard Service Entry Sheet app will not change.

These references provide further details

Lean Service Entry Sheets

Invoice Processing with Taxes in S/4HANA Cloud

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Update signatory in BIR Form No. 2307 (Run Statutory...
entry.content:
Hi @Suvarna4 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Philippines localization), the digital signature on BIR Form No. 2307 (Certificate of Creditable Tax Withheld at Source) is controlled via form template customization.

Here is how you can update the digital signatory

  1. First, go to the Maintain Form Templates app (F1814).
  2. Then search for the delivered template for BIR Form 2307.
    • Template name usually starts with PH_2307….
  3. Thereafter download the template and edit it in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.
    • Update the digital signatory field with the required person’s name, position and signature image (if applicable).
  4. Upload the updated template back via Maintain Form Templates.
  5. Finally, assign the updated template in Output Parameter Determination for statutory reporting.

Here are some important notes

  • The standard delivered form only provides a placeholder for the digital signature. You must maintain it manually in your custom copy.
  • For official submission, ensure compliance with BIR digital signing requirements (certificate, authorization).

SAP References:

  • Localization for Philippines – Withholding Tax Certificates
  • Maintain Form Templates App

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: DRC eDocument .html file / Tax Payer ID
entry.content:
Hi @chralb 

Thank you for your question. I hope this still helps.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud with DRC for Hungary, the Taxpayer ID used in the XML/HTML structure comes from Supplier Master Data (Business Partner), not from the Company Code settings.

Here is where the Taxpayer ID comes from

  • Supplier Tax Number --> Taxpayer ID is mapped from the Business Partner -->  Identification Numbers section.
  • The field you entered at Company Code level is the VAT Registration Number (Community VAT), which is why it flows into the "communityVatNumber" element instead.
  • For Hungary, the Taxpayer ID is a separate mandatory field and must be maintained correctly in the Supplier Master, which is the Business Partner.

Here is how you can maintain it

  1. Open the Manage Business Partner Master Data app.
  2. Search for the supplier, in this case your Business Partner.
  3. Navigate to Identification --> Tax Numbers.
  4. Maintain the Tax Number Category corresponding to Hungary’s Taxpayer ID.
    • Use the correct country-specific tax type.
  5. Save and re-run the eDocument generation.

Here are some important notes

  • The Hungarian Taxpayer ID must be 11 digits, structured in blocks (e.g. 12345678-1-12).
  • DRC differentiates between Community VAT Number and Local Taxpayer ID. Both can exist in parallel.

See below references for more details:

  • Localization Hungary DRC Withholding Reporting
  • Maintain Business Partner Tax Numbers

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: BOP is not working for MTO scenerio
entry.content:
Why BOP is not confirming Sales Orders in MTO (Strategy B6) in your case is because of the following:

1. Strategy Group B6 Behavior
B6 = Make-to-Order with Planning (Planned Order created, linked to sales order). The requirement is sales order-specific, meaning the planned order is tied to the sales order item. ATP logic works manually because it checks the link between the planned order and the sales order directly.

2. BOP “Improve” Strategy
“Improve” tries to reallocate confirmations based on availability and priority (e.g., FIFO). But in MTO, the planned order is not considered general stock—it’s pegged to the sales order. BOP may skip these requirements unless the pegging relationship is properly recognized.

What you can do to fix it are

A. Use Confirmation Strategy “Win” Instead of “Improve”
“Win” forces confirmation of selected requirements if supply exists. “Improve” is more flexible but may not override pegging constraints in MTO. Try switching your BOP variant to use “Win” for MTO segments.

B. Ensure BOP Segment Includes MTO Requirements
In Configure BOP Segment, make sure you include sales orders with strategy B6. You don’t filter out requirements with pegged planned orders. You use characteristics like Requirement Type = KE or Strategy Group = B6.

C. Check Requirement Transfer Settings
Ensure that requirement transfer is active for the sales order item. If requirements aren’t transferred correctly, BOP won’t see them.

D. Schedule BOP Run After Planned Order Firming
Use Schedule BOP Run app to trigger BOP after planned order is firmed. You can automate this via Job Scheduling in SAP S/4HANA Cloud like Job 1: MRP run (firm planned order) and Job 2: BOP run (with “Win” strategy)

Why Manual ATP works but BOP does not is because, manual ATP checks the pegged supply directly and confirms the sales order. BOP, however, uses segments and confirmation strategies that may not recognize pegged supply unless configured properly.

Some of the SAP references are

Confirmation Strategies on BOP by @Andreas_Krause1 

Backorder Processing in Advanced ATP

entry.title: Re: Creating Custom Post-processing of the Output Payment...
entry.content:
Hi @RameshYekambram 

Thank you for your question. I hope this still provides some help.

Here is how this works and why you see the issue:

  1. Why multiple files are generated

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the payment medium workbench generates one output file per payment order.

  • If multiple invoices are bundled into one payment, the system should generate a single file with all items.
  • The behaviour you describe indicates that the file merge happens incrementally and your custom logic is being applied on each iteration instead of once at the end.
  1. Here is why the BAdI is not triggered
  • The BAdI you are using is likely not the correct enhancement spot for post-processing of payment files. In Public Cloud, the relevant enhancement is:
    • BAdI FI_PAYMEDIUM_POSTPROCESS --> Postprocessing of Payment Medium File. This is available in Custom Logic app.
  • If you used a different BAdI for exammple during payment proposal or payment order creation, it will not be triggered at the final output file generation stage.
  1. The correct approach to capture all invoices in one file is to
  • Make use of BAdI FI_PAYMEDIUM_POSTPROCESS. This has been released for S/4HANA Cloud.
  • This BAdI is triggered after the payment file is generated and it receives the entire payment file content. Inside your implementation, you have the possibility to:
    • Access all invoices belonging to the payment.
    • Perform final formatting or concatenation.
    • Ensure that only one file per payment order is produced, with all invoices included.
  1. Here are few checklists you should go through
  • Go to Custom Logic app --> search for enhancement FI_PAYMEDIUM_POSTPROCESS.
  • Implement your logic here and not in earlier BAdIs.
  • Test with a payment run including multiple invoices.
  • Verify that the BAdI executes once per file and contains all items.

The references provide more details:

  • Custom Post-processing of Payment Files
  • BAdI FI_PAYMEDIUM_POSTPROCESS – Business Add-Ins for Payment Medium Workbench

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Expert Advice Needed – Recurring Job Setup in AFC for...
entry.content:
To the question "Can You Schedule a Task to Run Daily Over a Date Range?", the short answer is Not directly as a single recurring task. AFC does not currently support recurrence rules (like “run daily from Day 1 to Day 5”) within a single task definition. Instead, you’ll need to create multiple instances of the same task, each assigned to a specific day.

Recommended approach is to create a Task List Template for your month-end close. Within the template, define five separate tasks for “Automatic Clearing – G/L Open Items” on Day 1, Day 2, ..., Day 5. Assign each task to the appropriate execution date using the Closing Structure Folder or Task List Header Parameters.

To the question How to maintain Dependencies across those days? and how to ensure that “Foreign Currency Valuation” runs after clearing each day, you can use Task Dependencies:

For each day, create a pair of tasks:

  • Task A: “Automatic Clearing – G/L Open Items”
  • Task B: “Foreign Currency Valuation”

In the Manage Closing Task Lists app:

  • Set Task B as a successor to Task A for each day.
  • Use the “Predecessor Task” field to define the dependency.

This ensures that valuation only runs after clearing has successfully completed on that day.

Example Task List Structure

entry.title: Re: Data source extension for outgoing checks
entry.content:
Hi @Melle1028 

Thank you for your question. I hope this still provides some insights.

Yes, in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there are extensibility options for outgoing checks triggered from the Manage Automatic Payments app and managed in the Manage Outgoing Checks app.

Data Source Extension Availability

  • Extensibility via Custom Fields and Logic App:
    You can extend standard apps such as "Clear Outgoing Payments" which is related to outgoing payments or checks by adding custom fields using the Custom Fields and Logic app. The relevant business context for extensibility is typically the Coding Block (FINS_CODING_BLOCK).
  • Out-of-the-box Reporting or Data Source Extensions:
    While the standard app "Manage Outgoing Checks" allows you to monitor outgoing checks, there is limited direct support for extending its underlying data sources. However, many financial apps allow extensibility through CDS views, OData APIs, or custom analytical queries.
  • App Extensibility Documentation:
    SAP provides documentation on app extensibility, including steps to extend apps via key user tools and business contexts. For specific cases, consult SAP's extensibility guides for Public Cloud and consider if custom CDS or API development is needed for deeper reporting or integration.

If your requirement goes beyond simple field addition, further development with custom APIs or analytical queries may be needed. For direct extensibility in the context of outgoing check management, always check available business contexts and SAP documentation in your system.

Here are some references to guide you.

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library for "Manage Outgoing Checks"

App Extensibility: Clear Outgoing Payments

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Mapping between Transaction Type and Subitems using GRPL
entry.content:
GRPL doesnt allow for sign based mapping, so you can default 915 to either 921 or 931. After that you can use a sign based Dr Cr reclass rule to assign debit values to 921 and Cr values to 931.
Visual way to see the different mappings between TType and Subitem - There is no mapping as such, transaction types in S/4HANA become Subitems in Group Reporting. Subitems need to be defined as a config item. If you want subitems to be different than the S/4HANA transaction type, then GRPL substitution rules are needed or GRDC mapping. These can only be viewed in the app or the GRDC mapping file.
Ttype to Subitem mapping can be done in GRDC as well and GRDC does support sign based mapping. Impact - additional license cost for GRDC, its not free with Group Reporting, and drill through to accounting documents from Group Reporting will not be possible any more. Plus all the additional set up of import jobs in GRDC.

 

Regards
Vineet

entry.title: Re: Creating Custom Post-processing of the Output Payment...
entry.content:
To the question, why multiple files are being generated, this usually happens when:

  • the output determination logic is triggered per invoice, not per payment.
    the BAdI implementation is scoped to the invoice level, causing it to execute multiple times.
    the system accumulates invoice data across runs, generating separate files with overlapping content.

Here are common causes as to why the BAdI not triggered

1. Wrong BAdI Implementation Point
Ensure you're using the correct BAdI for post-processing:

For payment media output, the relevant BAdIs are typically:

  • FIBL_PAYMEDIUM_X (for classic payment medium programs)
  • BADI_FPAYMEDIUM (for payment medium workbench)
  • BADI_PAYM_OUTPUT (for newer output control framework)

If you're using Output Management (BRF+ based) in S/4HANA Cloud, the BAdI should be BADI_PAYM_OUTPUT_POSTPROCESSING. If this BAdI isn’t triggered, check whether your output type is correctly assigned to the payment method and whether the output determination is set to “Send Immediately.”

2. Output Triggered at Invoice Level
If the output is being triggered per invoice, the BAdI won’t consolidate all invoices into one file. You need to:

  • Ensure the output is triggered at the payment document level (FPAYH), not FPAYHX or FPAYP.
  • Use grouping logic in your BAdI to collect all invoices tied to the payment run.

Follow the below process so that you will get answer to the question "How to ensure a single output file per Payment

A. Group Invoices in BAdI Logic
In your BAdI implementation use the payment run ID or payment document number to group all related invoices. Accumulate invoice data in an internal table. Generate the output file only once per payment document.

B. Use BRF+ Output Control
If you're using SAP S/4HANA Output Management, configure BRF+ rules to trigger output only once per payment document. Avoid multiple output triggers for each invoice.

C. Check Output Parameter Settings
In the Manage Output Parameter Determination app ensure the output type is set to trigger once per payment. Avoid using invoice-specific conditions unless absolutely necessary.

Finally, the link you referred to is part of SAP’s Localization Self-Service Learning Journey, which focuses on customizing output formats. However, it doesn’t cover the execution logic or BAdI behavior in depth. For that, you’ll want to explore:

Payment Medium Workbench 

This page explains:

  • How PMW replaces classic RFFO* programs
  • Configuration steps for payment formats
  • Integration with DME administration
  • Output logs and payment advice generation

Creating Payment Media 

This guide walks through:

  • How to use PMW during payment runs
  • Format-specific mapping and output logic
  • How payment advice notes are generated alongside payment files

entry.title: Re: Cancellation of Depreciation Run
entry.content:
To reverse or cancel a depreciation run in SAP ECC 6.0, especially for Company Code 1000, Fiscal Year 2025, Period 7, you’ll need to follow a structured process. SAP doesn’t offer a direct “cancel” button for depreciation runs, but you can reverse the posted depreciation documents and reprocess them after correcting the asset setup.

Here’s your step-by-step guide:

Step 1: Identify the Depreciation Documents
Use transaction ABGL or AB03 to view the depreciation postings. Alternatively, go to FB03 and filter by:

  • Company Code = 1000
  • Fiscal Year = 2025
  • Period = 7
  • Document Type = AF (Asset Financial)

This helps you confirm which documents were posted during the depreciation run.

Step 2: Reverse the Depreciation Documents
SAP doesn’t allow reversal via AFAB directly. You must reverse the FI documents manually. Use transaction FB08 to reverse each depreciation document:

  • Enter the document number
  • Ensure the reversal date is in the same fiscal year and period (or an open period)
  • Post the reversal

If multiple documents exist, consider using F.80 for mass reversal.

Step 3: Correct the Asset Master Data
Use AS02 to update the asset master record. Fix the incorrect setup (e.g., depreciation key, useful life, cost center, etc.). Save the changes.

Step 4: Recalculate Planned Depreciation
Run AFAR (Recalculate Depreciation) for the corrected asset. This updates the planned depreciation values based on the new setup.

Step 5: Re-run the Depreciation
Use AFAB to re-execute the depreciation run:

  • Company Code: 1000
  • Fiscal Year: 2025
  • Period: 7
  • Ensure “Repeat Run” is selected
  • Run in Test Mode first to validate

Once validated, run in Update Mode to post the corrected depreciation.

Finally and most importantly, Do not use transaction OAGL to reset depreciation in a live system. It’s meant for test environments only. Ensure period 7 is open in OB52 for posting reversals and reprocessing. If fiscal year closing has already been done via AJAB, you’ll need to reopen it using OAAQ before making changes.

entry.title: Re: Change user WO resp not possible batch wise anymore
entry.content:
Some possible workarounds are

1. Mass Change via IW38 or COHV
You can mass update certain fields using transaction IW38 or COHV (Mass Processing). However, “User Responsible” is often excluded from editable fields once the WO is TECO’d. This is by design, as SAP locks certain fields post-TECO to preserve audit integrity.

2. Custom Batch Job Using BAPI
You can use BAPI_ALM_ORDER_MAINTAIN to update WOs programmatically—even for TECO’d orders. This requires a custom report or job, Logic to skip CLOSED WOs, Authorization checks to ensure compliance. This approach has been successfully used by other customers to mass-update fields like cost center, planner group, and user responsible—even post-TECO.

If you need an immediate fix:

  • Ask your technical team to build a Z-report using BAPI_ALM_ORDER_MAINTAIN
  • Filter WOs by status ≠ CLOSED
  • Update “User Responsible” in batch
  • Log changes for audit trail

entry.title: Re: Pack Handling units for multiple Inbound Delivery items
entry.content:
Yes, it’s possible to pack multiple inbound delivery items into multiple handling units (1:1 mapping) using ABAP, but GN_DELIVERY_CREATE has limitations when it comes to complex packing scenarios across multiple items. For more granular control, you’ll want to use function module WS_DELIVERY_UPDATE, which is more flexible and supports packing logic for both inbound and outbound deliveries.

Recommended approach

Use WS_DELIVERY_UPDATE - This FM allows you to assign external HU numbers, Pack multiple delivery items into multiple handling units, Control packing at the item level using table IT_HANDLING_UNITS. Discuss with your ABAP team for key structures to populate.

Some tips are

  • Make sure the delivery items are not already packed or locked.
  • Use VL32N to simulate the packing manually first—this helps validate your logic.
  • If you’re using batch-managed materials, ensure batch data is passed correctly.
  • Refer to SAP Note 581282 for packing via FM/BAPI.
